page.title: 19Local history in Storrington
page.content: { { The story of "Sleepy Hollow" Originally this area was called The Sanctuary, a small settlement which grew up around a young girl who, believing that the Sermon on the Mount was practical politics and in an effort to set her own house in order, gave away most of her money in the form of land to literally whoever asked for it. She felt that land, that most basic of necessities, should be freely owned. Vera and her settlers lived the simple life, close to nature, spinning, weaving, sandal-making, tending goats, hens and growing food. They made their own amusements, singing round the camp-fire, staging plays, reciting poems, folk dancing on the village green and keeping open house to all and sundry. There was a free guest
